intro: Deinbollia saligna, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically forms dense mats on the ground. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are narrow, silky in texture, and often have a bluish-gray hue. Deinbollia saligna thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
